DOC.brief_summary: Using randomize controlled trial design , two hydration protocol prevention contrast medium-induced nephropathy test .
DOC.brief_title: Prevention Contrast Renal Injury With Different Hydration Strategies
DOC.detailed_description: The study population recruit subject undergoing cardiac catheterization . Subjects randomize one two hydration protocol : 1. normal saline 3 mL/kg one hour prior contrast exposure 1.5 mL/kg/hr four hour post procedure . 2. normal saline 3 mL/kg one hour prior contrast exposure fluid rate would adjust accord leave ventricular end diastolic pressure ( LVEDP ) . The fluid rate base upon LVEDP measurement maintain procedure four hour post procedure . The LVEDP hydration strategy follow : ( 2A ) < 13 mmHg , 5 mL/kg/hr four hour post procedure . ( 2B ) 13-18 mmHg , 3 mL/kg four hour post procedure . ( 2C ) > 18 mmHg , 1.5 mL/kg four hour post procedure . Renal function assessment make use standard laboratory measure post procedure .
DOC.criteria: estimate GFR less equal 60 mL/min/1.73 m^2 age great 18 year least one following : diabetes mellitus , history congestive heart failure , hypertension , age great 75 year . patient unable give consent undergo emergency cardiac catheterization renal replacement therapy exposure contrast medium within prior two day pulmonary edema active congestive heart failure kidney transplant status severe valvular abnormality change serum creatinine great 15 % prior two day
